item.title: 【Fraud Detection Using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning】使用人工智能和机器学习的欺诈检测
item.description:

Introduction 

For industries such as e-commerce, finance, and insurance where transactional security is paramount, fraud detection is a pressing challenge. Until a decade ago, organizations were relying on predefined rules and thresholds which are often not sufficient to detect fraudulent activities.  With the advent of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), organizations are enabling automated, adaptive, and real time anomaly detection techniques for fraud detection.

In this article we will do a detailed review of AI and ML methodologies in fraud detection, including supervised, unsupervised, and deep learning techniques. Furthermore, this article also delves into the challenges of using AI in fraud detection.

】

简介

对于电子商务，金融和保险等行业，交易安全至关重要，欺诈检测是一个紧迫的挑战。直到十年前，组织一直依靠预定义的规则和阈值，这些规则和阈值通常不足以检测欺诈活动。  随着人工智能（AI）和机器学习（ML）的出现，组织正在实现自动化，适应性和实时的欺诈检测技术。

item.title: 【Ensuring Configuration Consistency Across Global Data Centers】确保整体数据中心的配置一致性
item.description:
【

Abstract

Today, nearly every large company operates several data centers distributed across the globe. Each of these data centers hosts a variety of infrastructure services such as MySQL, Redis, Hive, and message queues.

For scalability and adherence to the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle in system design, it's crucial that the same codebase is used across all regions. However, engineers responsible for writing and maintaining this code are often spread across different geographies. As a result, teams may not always be aligned on system configurations—even within the same region. This misalignment leads to discrepancies in configuration across data centers.

】

今天，几乎每个大型公司都经营着分布在全球范围内的几个数据中心。这些数据中心每个中心都有各种基础架构服务，例如 mysql ，redis，hive，hive和message queues。

item.title: 【Agentic AI for Automated Application Security and Vulnerability Management】用于自动化应用程序安全性和漏洞管理的代理AI
item.description:
【

It was not so long ago that I was having a much closer look at how AI is becoming embedded in our everyday developer work. I have watched more intelligent code suggestions, automated testing routines, and those ubiquitous chatbots become a normal part of the everyday toolkit. They are useful, naturally, but at their core, they are still fundamentally reactive, they still wait for you to inquire of them before taking action.

What has really blown me away recently is the emergence of agentic AI. It is completely different, it does not just sit around and wait to be told what to do, but instead it takes charge itself. It can decide what should be done, strategize the steps, and even adjust if something unexpected happens. It's sort of like having a colleague who is always planning ahead, as opposed to merely carrying out orders.

】

不久前，我正在仔细研究AI如何嵌入我们的日常开发人员工作中。我已经观看了更智能的代码建议，自动测试例程，而这些无处不在的聊天机器人成为日常工具包的正常部分。它们自然很有用，但是从根本上讲，它们仍然具有反应性，他们仍然在等待您在采取行动之前询问它们。

最近真正炸毁了我的是Agesic AI的出现。它是完全不同的，它不仅坐在周围等待被告知该怎么做，而且还可以自行负责。它可以决定应采取的措施，制定步骤，甚至可以调整发生意外的事情。这就像有一个总是在提前计划的同事，而不是仅执行订单。

item.title: 【A Deep Dive Into Firmware Over the Air for IoT Devices】深入探究物联网设备的固件
item.description:
【

An Overview of IoT Devices and FOTA

IoT devices are a combination of hardware and software which are programmed to collect and transmit the data over to the internet, other networks, or a variety of applications. There are various categories of IoT devices such as sensors, actuators, machines, gateways, and more. These IoT devices can be used independently, or can be attached to any other devices such as appliances, doors, industrial machinery, medical equipment, and other important assets. In today’s fast-paced environment, these devices offer the capability to provide all important sensory information without any manual intervention to their users via integrations with mobile apps or analytical platforms. These sensors solve various real-world problems such as asset tracking, infrastructure management, condition-based monitoring, industrial automation, and more. 

Companies that offer IoT solutions have to deploy and manage a large number of IoT devices in globally-dispersed locations. To make sure that all the devices are working and transmitting the telemetry data as expected without any failure, it is very important to monitor these devices and keep them updated with the latest version of their firmware or software. These new versions of the firmware may contain bug fixes, patches for security vulnerabilities, or new functionalities throughout the device’s lifecycle. Since IoT devices are low powered, low memory constrained devices, and deployed at distributed locations, it is crucial to do firmware upgrades over the air (FOTA) for these devices. FOTA happens remotely, and users do not need to be physically available at the same location. FOTA is an essential process for any IoT solution offerings as it enables IoT devices to provide uninterrupted flow of data to the users.

】

IoT设备和FOTA

的概述

IoT设备是硬件和软件的组合，这些硬件和软件被编程为以将数据收集和传输到Internet，其他网络或各种应用程序。有各种类型的物联网设备，例如传感器，执行器，机器，网关等。这些物联网设备可以独立使用，也可以连接到任何其他设备，例如设备，门，工业机械，医疗设备和其他重要资产。在当今快节奏的环境中，这些设备提供了通过与移动应用程序或分析平台的集成为其用户提供所有手动干预的所有重要感官信息的能力。这些传感器解决了各种现实世界中的问题，例如资产跟踪，基础架构管理，基于条件的监控，工业自动化等。 

提供IoT解决方案的公司必须部署和管理大量 IOT设备”> IOT设备为了确保所有设备都可以按预期工作和传输遥测数据，而不会发生任何故障，因此监视这些设备并保持最新版本的固件或软件非常重要。这些新版本的固件可能包含错误修复程序，用于安全漏洞的补丁程序或整个设备生命周期中的新功能。由于物联网设备的功率低，内存限制的设备低，并且在分布式位置部署，因此对于这些设备进行固件升级（FOTA）至关重要。 FOTA发生远程发生，用户不需要在同一位置进行物理上的可用。 FOTA是任何物联网解决方案产品的重要过程，因为它使IoT设备能够向用户提供不间断的数据流。

item.title: 【Agile and Quality Engineering: A Holistic Perspective】敏捷和质量工程：整体观点
item.description:
【

Introduction

Agile has emerged as a widely adopted and effective software development methodology, enabling teams to deliver high-quality products to end-users with increased speed and efficiency. Within Agile frameworks such as Scrum, high-level software requirements or business needs are systematically decomposed into smaller, manageable units known as epics, which are further refined into user stories. Each user story is defined with specific acceptance criteria to ensure clarity in implementation and validation.

Collaboration is a fundamental principle of Agile software development, emphasizing collective ownership and teamwork over individual contributions. Agile methodologies prioritize a "we" mindset, fostering a cohesive Scrum team that works iteratively to achieve project goals. Agile projects are executed in time-boxed iterations known as sprints, typically lasting two to four weeks. At the end of each sprint, the team produces a potentially shippable increment of the software. Various ceremonies, such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives, facilitate continuous improvement and alignment within the Scrum team.

】

简介

敏捷已成为一种广泛采用的有效的软件开发方法，使团队能够以提高速度和效率的最终用户提供高质量的产品。在敏捷框架（例如Scrum，High-Level软件要求或业务需求）等敏捷框架被系统地分解为较小的，可管理的单位，这些单元被称为Epics，这些单元被进一步完善，这些单位被进一步精炼到用户故事中。每个用户故事都具有特定的接受标准，以确保实施和验证方面的清晰度。

协作是敏捷软件开发的基本原则，强调集体所有权和团队合作而不是个人贡献。敏捷的方法论优先考虑“我们”的心态，促进了一个迭代实现项目目标的凝聚力的Scrum团队。敏捷项目在被称为Sprints的时迭代迭代中执行，通常持续2到四个星期。在每次冲刺的结尾，团队会产生该软件的潜在易发性增量。各种仪式，例如冲刺计划，日常站立，冲刺评论和回顾展，促进了Scrum团队的持续改进和一致性。
